intro: Anacampseros varians, commonly known as the variable stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun. Anacampseros varians is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
